verbs.description: [ARG0: some radio stations] [V: pull] [ARG1: indian outlaw song] [ARGM-TMP: after protest an indian leader claim that a country music song lyrics are racially offensive has resulted in several radio stations pulling indian outlaw from their play list but the management company for singer tim mcgraw says the song is not meant to be insulting and the few protests the company received have come mainly from the cherokee nation based in tahlequah cherokee principal chief wilma mankiller wrote mcgraw a letter last week objecting to the song as he prepared for a concert in tulsa mankiller also faxed] a letter to radio stations statewide [ARGM-TMP: urging program directors to not] be a party to this kind of exploitive bigotry johnny slate cherokee [ARGM-TMP: nation tim mcgraw cherokee heritage george griffith radio lynn howard cherokee principal chief wilma mankiller] tahlequah

some radio stations pull indian outlaw song after protest [ARG0: an indian leader] [V: claim] [ARG1: that a country music song lyrics are racially offensive] has resulted in several radio stations pulling indian outlaw from their play list but the management company for singer tim mcgraw says the song is not meant to be insulting and the few protests the company received have come mainly from the cherokee nation based in tahlequah cherokee principal chief wilma mankiller wrote mcgraw a letter last week objecting to the song as he prepared for a concert in tulsa mankiller also faxed a letter to radio stations statewide urging program directors to not be a party to this kind of exploitive bigotry johnny slate cherokee nation tim mcgraw cherokee heritage george griffith radio lynn howard cherokee principal chief wilma mankiller tahlequah

some radio stations pull indian outlaw song after protest an indian leader claim that [ARG1: a country music song lyrics] [V: are] [ARG2: racially offensive] has resulted in several radio stations pulling indian outlaw from their play list but the management company for singer tim mcgraw says the song is not meant to be insulting and the few protests the company received have come mainly from the cherokee nation based in tahlequah cherokee principal chief wilma mankiller wrote mcgraw a letter last week objecting to the song as he prepared for a concert in tulsa mankiller also faxed a letter to radio stations statewide urging program directors to not be a party to this kind of exploitive bigotry johnny slate cherokee nation tim mcgraw cherokee heritage george griffith radio lynn howard cherokee principal chief wilma mankiller tahlequah

some radio stations pull indian outlaw song after protest an indian leader claim that a country music song lyrics are racially offensive [V: has] resulted in several radio stations pulling indian outlaw from their play list but the management company for singer tim mcgraw says the song is not meant to be insulting and the few protests the company received have come mainly from the cherokee nation based in tahlequah cherokee principal chief wilma mankiller wrote mcgraw a letter last week objecting to the song as he prepared for a concert in tulsa mankiller also faxed a letter to radio stations statewide urging program directors to not be a party to this kind of exploitive bigotry johnny slate cherokee nation tim mcgraw cherokee heritage george griffith radio lynn howard cherokee principal chief wilma mankiller tahlequah

some radio stations pull indian outlaw song after protest [ARG1: an indian leader] claim that [ARG1: a country music song lyrics are racially offensive] has [V: resulted] [ARG2: in several radio stations pulling indian outlaw from their play list] but the management company for singer tim mcgraw says the song is not meant to be insulting and the few protests the company received have come mainly from the cherokee nation based in tahlequah cherokee principal chief wilma mankiller wrote mcgraw a letter last week objecting to the song as he prepared for a concert in tulsa mankiller also faxed a letter to radio stations statewide urging program directors to not be a party to this kind of exploitive bigotry johnny slate cherokee nation tim mcgraw cherokee heritage george griffith radio lynn howard cherokee principal chief wilma mankiller tahlequah
